details.description: Your Child Benefit number and where to find it, how to prove you qualify for Child Benefit if asked
details.body:
Your Child Benefit number is on your Child Benefit award notice, any paperwork you have from the Child Benefit Office and your bank statement. You can use it to prove you qualify for Child Benefit.

Your Child Benefit number starts with ‘CHB’ and is made up of 8 numbers and 2 letters, eg CHB12345678 AB.

You’ll also see the 8 numbers of your Child Benefit number on your bank statement next to your Child Benefit payments.

You can contact the Child Benefit Office to get your Child Benefit number.

Say on the form you’re looking for the number, and if someone else has asked for it, tell the Child Benefit Office who. HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) might be able to send it to them for you.

You can also get your Child Benefit number by calling the Child Benefit Helpline:

Child Benefit Helpline
Telephone: 08453 021 444
Textphone: 08453 021 474
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, 8am to 4pm

When you might need your Child Benefit number

Having your number can speed things up if:

  • you’ve had Child Benefit before and are making a new claim
  • you’re telling the Child Benefit Office about a change of circumstances
  • you’re making a claim for tax credits

Proof of Child Benefit

If you’re asked to prove you qualify for Child Benefit (eg to claim free school meals), check with whoever’s asking:

  • what proof they need
  • how up to date the proof needs to be

You might be asked for your Child Benefit award notice as proof of Child Benefit.

If you don’t have your award notice, you can also provide other proof, eg:

  • your latest tax credits award notice
  • a bank statement showing your Child Benefit going into your account

The Child Benefit Office doesnâ€™t provide written proof of your Child Benefit - you can use the documents listed above.
